title: 15 or even 10 minute surrender in extraordinary circumstances?

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Because really, yi doesn't pick until the last few seconds and demands jungle after I'm locked and ready to go jungle for at least 10 seconds.

The game begins and Dinger goes mid and immediately begins to feed. Yi heads bot. No longer feeling like jungling I move to bot lane.

Yi dies then immediately quits. I hang around briefly before shifting to mid. Dinger moves around and keeps feeding.

Zed gives up and quits. Why I had to spend the next while baring this shit and wasting my time was beyond me.

As for why the game went for so long, the other team were having fun with their game and I was the other person say no to the surrender votes :/ 

Wanted to see how long it took them to kill me. Took them long enough and by then the Nexus was wide open.

But my original point remains. There has to be an option to surrender under 20 if things are really really bad. It was just me and Grag at one point. Then dinger came back and resumed feeding. -_-

The game could have been over in 12 minutes had they grouped and shoved bot..

replies.body: I think they should take surrender out of the game, and make it if someone gets reported for afk and they are afk from no reason then perma ban. DONE no more ragers no more afks.

Your comment makes me think you associate every game where a surrender vote is called with toxic players and afkers, which is certainly not the case, there could be a skill cap between entire teams, where every lane loses and the jungler gets counter-jungled and all 5 people know it's pointless to continue, it's rare but i've been part of a few of those games, and usually on the losing side, i thanked jesus almighty and zeus as well that i didnt have to hold out for another 20-40 minutes, on top of which without the option to surrender common people like myself who are then in bad situations getting stomped may actually turn toxic because there is no other option other than to afk or sit in the base and wait for the enemy to push, while that isn't how things are meant to be done that is just one scenario of how the surrender option is a pro in my opinion
